llm.feedback: The draft conflates multiple assets (UST10Y, DXY, S&P 500) and mixes up the 2025 FOMC with 2025‑2026 timelines, violating the “single asset” rule. Remove all lines that reference UST10Y or DXY; keep only the S&P 500 swing trade. Replace the “Up/Down” mover lines with a single, coherent S&P 500 scenario: **Up | 1‑3 mo | Core PCE 2.6 % → Fed 25‑bp cut 16‑17 Sep 2025 → 10‑yr yield falls 25 bps → S&P up 0.5‑1 % (30‑60 pts)**, citing (U21K4ALYQ)(97MD1FHW8). Provide a probability of 80 % based on the 89 % cut probability and the 25‑bp yield‑to‑index sensitivity. For the swing trade line, specify: **Long | 1‑3 mo | Entry 6,460 | Stop 6,400 | Target 6,500 | R/R 1:1 | Invalidation 10‑yr > 4.30 % | Trigger 25‑bp Fed cut | Prob 80 % | Conf 90**. Ensure all citations are inline and only use IDs from the source. Drop any mention of Fed balance‑sheet contraction or DXY; those are irrelevant to the S&P trade. This yields a concise, actionable plan that meets the 4‑line mover requirement and the single‑asset focus.
